doc.after: Such a transformation is called a diagonalizable matrix since in the eigenbasis the transformation is represented by a diagonal matrix Because operations like matrix multiplication matrix inversion and determinant calculation are simple on diagonal matrices computations involving matrices are much simpler if we can bring the matrix to a diagonal form Not all matrices are diagonalizable even over an algebraically closed field
